App description:
The next Visual Novel awaits beyond the screen.

TOKYO CHRONOS is a VR Mystery Visual Novel told in an immersive 360 world. 

Characters with personality come to life right before your eyes  their fate lies in your hands. An empty, deserted Shibuya where time has frozen over. A suspenseful mystery woven by 8 childhood friends trapped inside. Lost memories; A strange message: I am dead. Who killed me? Who is I? Why did we lose our memory? Who is the killer? Fragments shattered like a broken mirror. Where does the truth lie? To kill, or not to kill  YOU decide. 

# Features 
- All-new Visual Novel designed for VR from the ground up
- Engrossing storyline with story duration of est. 15-20 hours 
- Over 5,000 lines of professionally voice-acted dialogue 
- Multiple routes and endings 

# Staff 
Director: Haruki Kashiwakura (Expelled from Paradise)
Script: Kou Segawa (Nazozuki Otome) 
Producer: Kazuma Miki (Sword Art Online) 
Character Design: LAM (Illustrator) 
Theme SongUNLIMITED / Eir Aoi

haloff11Mar 1 at 4:59 AM
Worth 40 if you like books/visual novel

I cleared all endings. It took me about 15-20 hours.

The game is like a visual novel but with 3D models instead of 2D pictures. For those who don't know, think of it as a book with voices, musics and pictures. There are some animations (just a little) though.

The graphics are nice, just like an anime. I personally didn't really enjoy the characters design, but it's a matter of personal taste. The 3D model are sufficiently detailed but I found the backgrounds lacking.

The voice acting is superb! The OST and the musics are absolutely wonderful. I can't find a single minus about it.

Since this is a visual novel, let's talk about the most important thing : the story. I can't say any spoiler, but I found it great. At least on par with very good visual novels/ books. It's like a mystery novel. While playing I managed to guess many things, but I also got things wrong. The story is quite emotional and serious. The true ending was so beautiful. I got teary eyes, which almost never happen...

There are next to no choices, unfortunately.

My biggest complaint is the skip function. It allows you to skip scenes you already saw, but it works by scene and not by sentence. If there is just one sentence that differs, then you can't use the skip function.

In term of immersion, does VR bring something?
YES! Definitely. You definitely feel more immersed in the story despite the lack of interaction. If there were much more interactions and choices, it would be so much better, but I understand the time and the budget of the developers are limited.

Conclusion : do I recommend it?

Must-buy:
If you like visual novel.
If you like anime and reading.

Recommended:
If you like anime.
If you like reading.

Not recommended:
If you don't like reading.
If you hate anime.

I complained a fair bit, but I still think very highly of the game. It's definitely worthy of 5 stars considering the price. At least to me.

PS: Ending A is best ending. Ahahahhaah!
My dearest,!

TriAnarchyJun 22 at 1:56 PM
A Masterpiece

Tokyo Chronos is a Visual Novel, for anyone not family with the genre, it is a choose your adventure type story, where you mostly watch the actions with occasional choices that direct the story. I am going to break this review into 2 parts: story and VR experience..


Story: no matter how pretty a visual novel is, storytelling is central to its quality and Tokyo Chronos absolutely shines. On the surface would describe it as a sci-fi murder mystery, but it is so much more than that, it is every genre possible, something only Sheakspears Hamlet could achieve. It is powerful and moving, the story is original and it doesnt feel forced. The game provides tremendous character depth, it allows you to compare how one sees themself and how others see the same person. The contrast is beautifully done. The ending is very satisfying and not what you think it is.


VR experience: The game is absolutely beautiful. The characters are beautifully designed, and you genuinely feel close them. The environment is absolutely incredible. I think I will re-play the game just so I can look around myself in some of the settings.

I am so glad i got this, an absolute most for any visual novel fan, and anyone who enjoys good storytelling in a new immersive environment.
